Articles.Content: I don't know why people here are so serious about this issue. It's just a game and please have fun. Those threads, talking about new parts, you can ignore them if you wish. All the information inside comes from squad cast , devnote, video that took by Scott Manley, Danny2462, HOCgaming and The solar gamer. Even squad itself release a trailer on YouTube, will you blame them for spoiling you? Gosh. These people here pay for this game, they love it so much and they deserve the right to know what's going on in the game development. If you do not want to be spoiled, then go camping in the cave for a century then when you go out, you can have the version 1.0 and great surprise.

Ok I think they spoiled a little too much on this one. I'm not saying I don't want to see anything on the new update but I don't want to see every feature. I like to explore a little myself. I voted 5/6 but the thing that bugs me is that it says "because they're taking too long". I don't think they are taking too long on this update, they can take all the time they want. They are doing a great job on this game and they never disappoint me on an update. I am very excited for this update but I think it would be nice to not see every feature but some features.

Fluffy bunnies are a lot better than what your post originally said

I must say I don't mind the change.

I don't know why people here are so serious about this issue. It's just a game and please have fun. Those threads, talking about new parts, you can ignore them if you wish. There's more to the issue than just "spoilers" about the new parts. As I see it, there are some people upset about the spoilers, some people upset because they felt misled by SQUAD's announcement the update was coming "soon", and some upset about both. The poll above links the two, even though they're separate concepts.

I, for one, don't give a crap about spoilers. If I did, I wouldn't watch the streams you listed above. And people who are upset about spoilers can take the same strategy. Besides, given how many places I've seen unique information about this release, I don't see how people can be all the upset about spoilers. BUT they're entitled to their own opinion about it.

As for the "soon" issue, Rowsdower has apologized for that, so in my mind, the specific issue has been sufficiently addressed.

I think it's a very good idea to release the full specifications of the new parts in advance. After all, KSP is a game you can play without actually running the software, so you can start playing with the update before it's released. In the last few days, I've planned a lot of things using the new parts, including lifter stages, Eve landers, and interplanetary transfer stages. Without that information, I wouldn't been able to play the game at all, as I've been on a business trip with not too much free time.

I just don't get that worked up about these things anymore. I'm excited to get my hands on the new release, but if it's taking longer than planned to squash the bugs, that's OK. I know what it's like to be putting out fires at the last minute.

So I'm quietly going nuts with anticipation over here.
I like it! HYPE!
id really just prefer a changelog be put out once experimentals are out.

Wow... so much about this post I disagree with:

  1. SQUAD has barely put anything out; a huge chunk of posted was mostly from media teams.
  2. IMO, spoiler avoidance is on the part of the viewer, not the source
  3. We've made it pretty clear that they hype was fine, it was the "Soon" crap was frustrating. This wouldn't have been an issue if SQUAD actually provided what they were hyping.
  4. Neither of the previous two points have anything to do with quality communication or transparency
  5. It seems pretty inappropriate for a mod to post something that has a such a mocking tone.

Sorry if you're frustrated with community members posting their opinions that you disagree with.

You know, you are not the only one participating in this conversation. And an awful lot of people are still taking issue with the hype itself, and feeling like the ARM has been "spoiled" for them. Sure, you may disagree with that, but that doesn't mean Vanamonde isn't addressing the concerns other people have raised here.

As for the mocking tone - I respectfully ask you to look at your own posts here, as well as reconsider what you think of as "mocking". All moderators are community members like you (and I) - not everything they say necessarily needs to be a moderator post, and I think it's safe to say that Vanamonde was actually just genuinely disappointed in the state of affairs here (which I can fully understand).

Now, as for "the 'Soon' crap" ... What exactly do you expect SQUAD to do by reiterating that over and over again? Release it yesterday? They said they're sorry for the unexpected delay, they said they're looking at options to mitigate this in the future. I understand your frustration - believe me, even I am frustrated that it's not released yet - but this is simply beating a dead horse. And for the love of god, stop acting like this delay means it won't be released for another month. I'm sure they're trying their best to get these last issues ironed out as soon as humanly possible, and April has indeed now begun across most of the world.

SQUAD has barely put anything out; a huge chunk of posted was mostly from media teams.

And yet they're being accused of over-hyping and over-spoiling. I was remarking upon the sad irony of this.

IMO, spoiler avoidance is on the part of the viewer, not the source

Use of the word "we" there is unjustified. Some of you have. But many posts in this thread show that others have not.

They still intend to. From what I understand, there was an unforeseen, last-minute complication. Nothing has been cancelled. It's just not coming as soon as some assumed and others hoped.

Well, on one hand, I would kinda wish that Squad would just give no hints at all of the release date, but on the other hand, I like it when they do, as long as it's just "Soon, unless something unforeseen happens", whic was what happened this time. Anyway, I'm still having fun in 0.23, I have a station to finish before ARM!

I don't mind hype... at least it's not like EA where after the hype has settled and millions of people have bought the game, the game turns out to have so many problems you are unable to play the game until months later, and even then the game still has problems.

*crying because EA*

I love the hype and I'm entirely relaxed about the release schedule. KSP is fantastic fun to play right now and it is just going to get better. In fact the only way it could get worse is if an update is released with serious bugs still in it.

As for worrying about spoilers, personally I find this weird. KSP doesn't have a narrative, we make that up for ourselves. The fun of new parts for me isn't discovering them in the VAB for the first time, it's building ships with them and flying them. I actively hoover up as much information as I can about new releases and I enjoy watching YouTube videos of other people playing the game, almost as much as playing it myself.

I like this level of hype, I absorb every bit of info I can get.

I don't regard any of it as 'spoiler' thus far. (though I would if they would for example post the exact contract generation parameters and options, I'd like to hear examples, I'd like to explore the limits myself). As for the ARM update, all we know is that we can now 'dock' to any part of a space rock, which can be pushed around. The amount of possibilities of fun that creates is so incomprehensible large it can't be spoiler-ed by looking at other peoples game-play. It is something one can only experience playing.

Concerning the 'delay' and backlash:

A delayed game is eventually good, a bad game is bad forever.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Replace 'game' with 'update'.

One can argue 'they' turned on the hype machine too early, dropped the ball on QA, and/or got caught in the hype themselves.

Remember: Both sides lost. They didn't intend this to happen, we didn't want it this way either. And be assured they of all are far FAR more aware of, and bothered by it than we are.

I am glad our community faces the mirror. We are not always as nice, helpful and tolerant as we like to believe. Painful, but confronting this aspect of our community is necessary in order for us to improve ourselves (no matter how futile such attempts at interlectual-Crowd-Control may seem)
